title: Bug 16938DCR: Class File Editor should scroll more naturally
description: 20020521 (F1) (This may not be a debug PRI wasn't sure). So the workaround, if the user wants to scroll through the Class File editor, is to always use the thumb.
OB: When a breakpoint is put in a java file, right before a System.out.println statement, and we debug to the breakpoint and step into the println call (maybe into StringBuffer first, all that matters is that we do not have the source for the class we just stepped into), a Class File Editor opens. When we click on the scrollbar's down arrow:
EB: The editor only scrolls one pixel at a time.
SR: The editor should scroll more than just one pixel at a time when clicking on the scrollbar's down arrow.
